required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Pelvic Floor Physiotherapy on Vaginal Elasticity
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Pelvic Floor Physiotherapy on Vaginal Elasticity as Measured by a Vaginal Tactile Imager

brief_summary.textblock: Women suffering from stress urinary incontinence are offered pelvic floor physiotherapy as an optional treatment. Strengthening of the pelvic floor is measured to date by manual examination and lacks precise evaluation. The vaginal tactile imager assists in evaluation of the changes in the pelvic floor after physiotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Women with stress urinary incontinence will undergo 6-10 pelvic floor strengthening physiotherapy sessions. The participants will undergo a short examination of vaginal elasticity using a vaginal tactile imager prior to beginning physiotherapy and additional examinations after 6 treatments, 10 treatments and 3 and 6 months post-treatment cessation.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study device became unavailable for use.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the treatment cessation up to 6 months post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: Changes in vaginal elasticity post physiotherapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the treatment cessation up to 6 months post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in the urogenital distress inventory questionnaire score (range 0-15)

arm_group.description: Women suffering from stress urinary incontinence

intervention.description: Vaginal elasticity evaluation using a vaginal tactile imager

study_pop.textblock: Women between 18-70 years of age, suffering from stress urinary incontinence, referred to pelvic floor physiotherapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women suffering from stress urinary incontinence.
Exclusion Criteria:
- women suffering from urge urinary incontinence.
- women suffering of mixed urinary incontinence.
